H0.text: Lakes are Earth's largest source of drinkable water.

H1.text: Rivers are Earth's largest source of drinkable water.

H2.text: Oceans are Earth's largest source of drinkable water.

H3.text: Aquifers are Earth's largest source of drinkable water.

A4.text: Freshwater lakes contain about 87% of this fresh surface water, including 29% in the African Great Lakes, 22% in Lake Baikal in Russia, 21% in the North American Great Lakes, and 14% in other lakes.

A5.text: Swamps have most of the balance with only a small amount in rivers, most notably the Amazon River.
